articles.title: Kim Jong Un Meets DPRK High-Level Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Meets DPRK High-Level Delegation 
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, Monday met members of the high-level delegation of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea which visited south Korea to attend the opening ceremony of the 23rd Winter Olympics.
					 Present at the meeting were the members of the delegation including Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yo Jong, first vice department director of the Central Committee of the WPK, Choe Hwi, chairman of the National Sports Guidance Committee, Ri Son Gwon, chairman of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Country, and other suite members.
					
					 On hand there were also Kim Yong Chol, vice-chairman of the C.C., the WPK, and Jo Yong Won, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK.
					
					 Kim Jong Un highly appreciated the efforts of the members of the delegation and other suite members while shaking their hands and listened to the detailed report by them.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam made the detailed report on the activities of the delegation including its participation in the opening ceremony of the 23rd Winter Olympics and visit to Chongwadae.
					
					 Kim Yo Jong who activated at the special instruction of Kim Jong Un made the detailed report on her contacts with the south side's high-level figures such as President Moon Jae In and the south side's intention and movement of the U.S. side and others which she grasped through her activities.
					
					 After receiving the delegation's report, Kim Jong Un expressed satisfaction over it and said that very impressive were the features of the south side which specially prioritized the visit of the members of the DPRK side who took part in the Winter Olympics including the high-level delegation making their possible and sincere efforts for the formers' convenience and activities and expressed thanks for them.
					
					 Noting that it is important to continue making good results by further livening up the warm climate of reconciliation and dialogue created by the strong desire and common will of the north and the south with the Winter Olympics as a momentum, he set forth in detail the orientation of the improvement of the north-south relations and gave important instructions to the relevant field to take practical measures for it.
					
					 He had a photo session with the members of the delegation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Members of Samjiyon Orchestra
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Members of Samjiyon Orchestra
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, met and had a photo session with the members of the Samjiyon Orchestra which returned home after successful congratulatory art performances for the 23rd Winter Olympics in the south side's region.
					 Kim Jong Un warmly congratulated the orchestra upon its successes by conveying the warm mind of the people in the north who are hoping for the successful Winter Olympics and national reconciliation and giving great joys to the fellow countrymen in the south through its performances.
					
					 After receiving a report on the atmosphere of the venues of the performances and echoes from the members of the orchestra, he expressed great satisfaction over it, saying that he was also pleased that the fellow countrymen in the south including President Moon Jae In and his wife expressed satisfaction over the performances while warmly responding and cheering them.
					
					 He gave thanks to the members of the Samjiyon Orchestra for successful performances at the highest level by preparing them in a brief span of time with their high artistic ability and sincere attitude and had a photo session with them.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Russian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Russian President
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of sympathy to Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, president of the Russian Federation, on Feb. 12 in connection with the passenger plane crash in Russia which caused huge casualties.
					 The message expressed deep sympathy and condolences to the president and through him to the victims and the bereaved families.
					
					 It sincerely hoped that the sorrow of the bereaved families will be overcome at the earliest date and stability be settled.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, received a message of greeting from Bashar Al-Assad, president of the Syrian Arab Republic, on Feb. 11.
					 Bashar Al-Assad in the message extended congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of February 16, the 76th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, who is alive, to be celebrated in the friendly DPRK.
					
					 He heartily wished Kim Jong Un good health and his dear family happiness as well as the friendly Korean people greater progress and wellbeing.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Russian FM
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Russian FM
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Ho, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a message of sympathy to his Russian counterpart Sergei Viktorovich Lavrov on Feb. 12 in connection with the passenger plane crash in Russia that claimed huge casualties.
					 The message expressed deep sympathy and condolences to the Russian foreign minister and, through him, to the victims and the bereaved families.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae Inspects South Hwanghae Province
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae Inspects South Hwanghae Province
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, Presidium member of the Political Bureau of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK, made a field survey of various units in South Hwanghae Province.
					 Going round the Samjigang Co-op Farm in Jaeryong County associated with the leadership feats of the peerlessly great men, he encouraged its peasants in working innovations in farming preparations and explained the requirements of the Party policy and the ways in introducing the scientific farming methods.
					
					 He also inspected the Sinchang Co-op Farm in Sinwon County, the Haeju Trailing Farm Machine Factory and the South Hwanghae Provincial Branch of the Academy of Agricultural Science, stressing the need for their party organizations and officials to fully discharge their mission as vanguard and standard-bearer in implementing the Party policies.
					
					 Field consultative meetings were held to discuss the measures for attaining the agricultural production goal for this year on the basis of the past successes and experience.

articles.title: U.S. and Japan Flayed for Hampering Improvement of Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
U.S. and Japan Flayed for Hampering Improvement of Inter-Korean Relations
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The director-general of the Institute for Disarmament and Peace of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK issued a statement on Tuesday over the fact that the United States and Japan, taken aback by stirring atmosphere of improvement and reconciliation in the inter-Korean relations, are running amuck to put whatever obstacles on this development.
					 Noting that the U.S. and Japan incited confrontation and hostility towards the DPRK at the opening ceremony of the current Winter Olympics where the whole world has extended warm congratulations in delight and joy to the north and the south of Korea for being one, the statement says:
					
					 The reckless moves of the U.S. and Japan constitute an open challenge to our sincere efforts for improving the inter-Korean relations and creating peaceful climate on the Koran peninsula as well as to the world public aspiring to the regional and global peace and stability.
					
					 Whenever the north and the south of Korea were engaged in talks to improve their relations, which led to the heightened atmosphere for national reunification, the U.S. and Japan did never fail to create huge obstacles by conducting such deliberate aggressive maneuvers as the large-scale joint military exercises.
					
					 The above facts demonstrate once again that the U.S. and Japan are the very culprits of destroying peace, aggravating situation and obstructing national reunification on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 If the U.S. and Japanese reactionaries continue to move in a self-centered manner against our national aspirations for peace and reunification and the international support to it, they will gain only isolation.
					
					 The U.S and Japan should bear in mind that their vicious words and actions will only reveal their sinister and crafty intentions and invite international opposition and denunciation, and they would be well advised to stop their imprudent and reckless actions.

articles.title: Japan's Intention in Faulting "Threats" from DPRK Exposed Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
Japan's Intention in Faulting "Threats" from DPRK Exposed 
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Jang Chol, a researcher of the Institute for Asian Studies at the Institute of International Studies, issued an article titled "We Expose Dirty Intention of Japan Persistently Faulting 'Threats' from DPRK" on Tuesday.
					 The Korean nation and the whole world are welcoming the hard-won atmosphere of reconciliation being created on the Korean peninsula, a land that had been frozen with confrontation and mistrust, and are unanimously expecting it to lead to the thaw in spring.
					
					 But Japan is making desperate efforts to chill the atmosphere, being displeased over the dramatic change taking place in the situation on the Korean peninsula, the article said.
					
					 What the Abe group seeks while persistently calling for "maximum pressure" is none other than exacerbation of the situation on the Korean peninsula to the extremes, the article said, disclosing the reason why the Japanese authorities are persistently faulting the "threats" form the DPRK.
					
					 The article said:
					
					 First, it is to lay a political groundwork for building a war state with "threats" from the DPRK as an established pretext.
					
					 Throughout history, Japan has used "foreign pressure" for realizing its ambition for becoming a big country.
					
					 Japan nurtured the vaulting ambition of the "conquest of Korea" after the "1868 Meiji Restoration". It annexed Korea as its colony while talking about threats from Qing Dynasty and Czarist Russia, and went crazy to put the Asian continent under its control with the Second World War as an occasion.
					
					 After its defeat, Japan used the Korean War and the Vietnamese War as occasions for "rapid growth" and rearmament and after the end of the Cold War, it paved the path for overseas dispatch of troops under the pretext of the U.S. "war on terrorism".
					
					 The present authorities of Japan are effectively using "threats" from the DPRK for suppressing the political forces standing in the way of establishing a war state.
					
					 Second, Japan aims at rebuilding a socio-economic foundation of a "country capable of fighting a war" with "threats" from the DPRK as a golden pretext.
					
					 Over more than half a century since the defeat of militarist Japan, the feelings of frustration following the defeat and war-weariness has pervaded the Japanese society and the new generation who had not experienced a war has emerged as the main players of society.
					
					 In the economic structure, the munitions industry has markedly shrunken as compared with the civilian industry or it has been deformed after being held down by the U.S. munitions-industrial conglomerates.
					
					 The awareness of urgency felt by the Japanese authorities is that unless Japan makes a fundamental change in such socio-economic structure, it would reduce into a country which can never fight a war. So they found "nuclear and missile threats" from the DPRK as the most appropriate pretext.
					
					 Third, Japan's aim is to distract the international community's serious eyes from its push for emerging as a military giant by citing "threats" from the DPRK as a pretext.
					
					 For over five years in office, the Abe regime made a giant stride forward for turning Japan into a military giant as evidenced by the identification of security strategy and the establishment of new state security council in 2013, institution of three principles on the transfer of defence hardware in 2014, the adoption of all-inclusive security law in 2015 and the revision of Japan-U.S. agreement on mutual provision of goods and labor in 2016.
					
					 This arouses due vigilance and serious concerns of the international community including the neighboring countries as it is a vivid revelation of dangerous ambition to retake the old position of the "leader of Asia".
					
					 To calm down and distract attention from it, Japan is going to use "nuclear and missile threats" from the DPRK as a shield.
					
					 The article stressed that as a responsible nuclear power which loves peace, the DPRK will never use nuclear weapons nor threaten any country or any region with nuclear weapons unless aggression-minded hostile forces encroach upon the sovereignty and interests of the DPRK, but will resolutely counter any acts of harassing peace and security of the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: 22nd Kimjongilia Festival Opens
articles.content:
22nd Kimjongilia Festival Opens
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The 22nd Kimjongilia Festival opened with due ceremony at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition here Tuesday to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Seen at the festival venue are photos of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Its theme is "Kimjongilia in full bloom in Juche Korea displaying its honor as the great power".
					
					 On show at the festival are tens of thousands of potted Kimjongilias cultivated by many units, including armed forces organs, ministries and national institutions, working people from all walks of life and school youth and children.
					
					 Also on display are flowers in praise of leader Kim Jong Il cultivated with much care by overseas compatriots' organizations including the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), overseas compatriots, diplomatic missions of various countries and international bodies here, friendship and solidarity organizations and personages of different countries.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Pak Kwang Ho, vice-chairman of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Jon Kwang Ho, vice-premier of the Cabinet, and officials of the festival organizing committee and the units which presented flowers to the festival, servicepersons and working people.
					
					 Also attending it were overseas compatriots and foreign guests who came here to take part in the 22nd Kimjongilia Festival.

articles.title: Schoolchildren's Art Performance Celebrates February Holiday
articles.content:
Schoolchildren's Art Performance Celebrates February Holiday 
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- A joint performance "We Sing of February Holiday" was given by art circle members of the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace on Tuesday to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The numbers of the performance, which began with chorus "Glory to Fatherly General", included instrumental ensemble immortal masterpiece "The Embrace of My Motherland" and male solo "General Represents Whole World".
					
					 The performers made deep depiction of strong yearnings and profound reverence of schoolchildren for Kim Jong Il.
					
					 There were also such numbers showing the happy looks of the schoolchildren who are growing up to be reliable pillars of the socialist power while cultivating their dreams and hopes under the loving care of the motherly Party and telling the iron truth that the future of Juche Korea is brighter and rosier as it is led by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Watching the performance were First Secretary of the Central Committee of the Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Youth League Pak Chol Min, officials concerned, officials of the youth league and school youth and children in Pyongyang.

articles.title: 7th National Pencil Drawing Festival Opens to Mark Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
7th National Pencil Drawing Festival Opens to Mark Day of Shining Star
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The 7th National Pencil Drawing Festival opened to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, the Day of the Shining Star.
					 Presented to the festival are more than 500 excellent pencil drawings created by service personnel and artists, working people of various strata, school youth and children and kindergartners across the country.
					
					 Seen at the centre of the festival venue is an art piece "Best wishes of all people" depicting the images of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 There are also drawings showing the boundless reverence of the Korean army and people for Kim Jong Il, who laid an eternal foundation for the building of a powerful and prosperous country, finding himself on the road of patriotic devotion for the country and the people all his life.
					
					 Some art pieces represent the fairyland-like appearance of the country where the peerlessly great men's patriotic wishes to build a powerful country are translated into reality under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un. And some are depicting the struggle of the Korean army and people performing miracles and innovations in every field of a great upswing.
					
					 Its opening ceremony was held at the Pyongyang International House of Culture on Tuesday.

articles.title: Agricultural Workers Meet
articles.content:
Agricultural Workers Meet
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Agricultural workers and members of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK) met at the Mangyongdae Vegetable Farm in Mangyongdae District Tuesday to celebrate the 76th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there were officials concerned and officials of the UAWK and agricultural workers.
					
					 A report was made there to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that Kim Jong Il provided an invincible treasured sword for accomplishing the socialist cause of Juche by clarifying the unique theory of building a powerful socialist country.
					
					 They noted that he led the UAWK organizations to creditably perform their duty as ideological education bodies and fully discharge their mission and responsibility as reliable supporter and helper of the Party in the drive for building socialist countryside and improving the standard of people's living.
					
					 They called upon the UAWK officials to conduct a vigorous political work among the agricultural workers so that all of them can carry forward the fighting spirit of the patriotic peasants in the Chollima era and become forerunners of Mallima in the on-going grand march.

articles.title: Russian Ambassador Hosts Reception to Mark Russian Day of Diplomatic Officials
articles.content:
Russian Ambassador Hosts Reception to Mark Russian Day of Diplomatic Officials 
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club Tuesday on the occasion of the Russian Day of Diplomatic Officials.
					 Present there on invitation were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Sin Hong Chol, Vice-Director General of the General Bureau for Affairs with Diplomatic Corps Mun Jae Chol, officials concerned and representatives and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Officials of the Russian embassy were on hand.

articles.title: 23rd Paektusan Prize Sports Contest among Officials of National Institutions Closes
articles.content:
23rd Paektusan Prize Sports Contest among Officials of National Institutions Closes
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The 23rd Paektusan Prize Sports Contest among Officials of National Institutions, which began on Jan. 22, closed with due ceremony at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street on Feb. 13.
					 The players competed, divided into four groups.
					
					 Teams of the State Planning Commission, the State Science and Technology Commission, the Taesong Bank and the Sci-Tech Complex came first in the tug of war.
					
					 Teams of the Ministry of Railways, the General Bureau of Public Catering Service, the Taesong Guidance Bureau and the Mansudae Art Studio won in the men's basketball matches.
					
					 Teams of the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection, the Education Commission, the Unha Guidance Bureau and the Sci-Tech Complex came first in the men's volleyball matches, teams of the Ministry of Mining Industry, the Foreign Trade Bank, the Myohyang Guidance Bureau and the Korean Revolution Museum in the women's volleyball matches, teams of the State Planning Commission, the General Bureau of Public Catering Service, the Taesong Bank and the Foreign Languages Publishing House in Taekwon-do matches and teams of the Ministry of Posts and Telecommunications, the General Bureau of Public Catering Service, the Taesong Bank and the Sci-Tech Complex in shooting matches.
					
					 Coming top in the group standings were teams of the State Planning Commission, the General Bureau of Public Catering Service, the Taesong Bank and the Sci-Tech Complex.
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were Choe Hwi, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea who is chairman of the National Sports Guidance Committee, Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier and chairman of the State Planning Commission who is vice-chairman of the National Sports Guidance Committee, and officials concerned and officials and players of ministries and national institutions.

articles.title: Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Arrives
articles.content:
Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Arrives
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- A congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star arrived here Tuesday. The group is led by Ko Tok U, chairman of the Nishi Tokyo Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Pay Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Pay Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- A congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill here on Tuesday.
					 The members of the congratulatory group laid bouquets before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Delegations of Juche Idea Study Groups Here
articles.content:
Delegations of Juche Idea Study Groups Here
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Delegations of Juche idea study organizations in different countries arrived here Tuesday to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They include a delegation of the Mongolian Juche idea study organization led by N. Bold, chairman of the Mongolian Centre for the Study of Juche, and a delegation of the Japanese Juche idea study society led by Yasuhito Fujii, deputy representative of the Gunma Liaison Council of Societies for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Staff members of UNDP, UNICEF, United Nations Population Fund, FAO, WFP and WHO missions here visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Tuesday on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star, the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il.
					 They paid tribute to the great leaders after laying floral baskets before their statues.
					
					 Meanwhile, Chinese guests and Koreans in China staying here to attend the 22nd Kimjongilia Festival laid floral baskets at the statues of the great leaders on the same day.

articles.title: Koreans in China Celebrate Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
Koreans in China Celebrate Day of Shining Star
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China held events to celebrate the 76th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 Attending the events were officials of the association including Chairwoman Choe Un Bok, delegates of its affiliated organizations, members of the Federation of Korean Economic Workers in China, Association of Young Korean Nationals in China and the Association of Korean Enterprisers in China, Korean nationals in Shenyang City and the DPRK consul general in Shenyang and officials of his consulate general and members of the DPRK branches working in China.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Koreans of all strata in China and personages in Liaoning Province and Shenyang City.
					
					 A meeting of the association took place in Shenyang of China on Feb. 8 to celebrate the Day of the Shining Star.
					
					 Choe Un Bok in her report said that leader Kim Jong Il had dedicated his whole life to the people's happiness, the country's reunification and accomplishment of the socialist cause, after his birth as the son of guerillas amid the blessing by all compatriots in the days of the anti-Japanese war, until the last moments of his life at a running train and thus performed the immortal revolutionary exploits before history and the people.
					
					 A letter to respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 Then, the participants watched a Korean film dealing with the efforts made by Kim Jong Il for improving the people's living standard.
					
					 Prior to the meeting, they looked round photos dealing with revolutionary activities of the peerlessly great persons of Mt Paektu and other pictures and books displayed at the venue of a photo and book exhibition for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star.
					
					 An art performance was given on Feb. 9 in celebration of the Day of the Shining Star.
					
					 On the same day there was a celebration reception.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Koreans' Association in China
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Koreans' Association in China
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a letter from the General Association of Koreans in China on Feb. 12 on the threshold of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 There are many famous politicians and great persons in the world, but it does not know such a peerless statesman and great revolutionary as Generalissimo Kim Jong Il who performed the immortal exploits before the history and people for the people's happiness, the country's reunification, the human cause of socialism and independence, the letter said.
					
					 It stressed his greatest exploit for the nation and the times is that he provided an eternal foundation for the prosperity of the country and the nation by firmly defending the fortress of socialism from the unprecedented vicious moves of the U.S. imperialists to isolate and stifle the DPRK and turning it into a nuclear weapons state and a satellite manufacturer and launcher which no formidable enemy dares to provoke.
					
					 It noted that he ushered in the June 15 era of reunification in which the noble ideal of By the Korean Nation Itself is translated into reality by providing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and thus performed the tremendous feats to be recorded in the nation's history of reunification movement forever.
					
					 The great exploits of Kim Jong Il, who adorned his whole life with warm love for the country and the nation and devoted service, would shine for all ages along with the powerful Paektusan nation which would be more prosperous, the letter stressed.

articles.title: Hwaebul Team of DPRK Overpowers Mongolian Team
articles.content:
Hwaebul Team of DPRK Overpowers Mongolian Team
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The first preliminary match between the DPRK's Hwaebul team and Mongolia's Erchim team belonging to Group I (East Asia) of the 2018 AFC Cup took place in Mongolia on Tuesday.
					 The Hwaebul team beat the Erchim team 4:0.
					
					 Ri Chang Ho scored two goals at about 8 minutes and 91 minutes and Ri Song and Ri Il San a goal at about 41 minutes and 85 minutes respectively.
					
					 The second match between the two teams is slated for February 20 in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Nearly 7 Million People Visit Paektusan Secret Camp
articles.content:
Nearly 7 Million People Visit Paektusan Secret Camp
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The number of visitors to the Paektusan Secret Camp is on the steady increase in the DPRK with the approach of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (February 16).
					 Since its opening on February 11, Juche 76 (1987) after the restoration to its original state, nearly seven million service personnel, working people, youths and school children have visited the secret camp.
					
					 The Paektusan Secret Camp is a secret base which President Kim Il Sung built as a center for leading the Korean revolution and as a stronghold for ensuring the guerilla activities of the main force of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army in the latter half of the 1930s, and the sacred place of revolution where leader Kim Jong Il was born.
					
					 Preserved in the secret camp are the headquarters log cabin where the President stayed, a log cabin where Kim Jong Il was born and other historic relics.
					
					 All the visitors to the sacred camp have refreshed their firm determination to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche, which was pioneered in Mt Paektu, under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un, keeping in their minds the revolutionary careers and immortal exploits of the peerlessly great persons.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Urges U.S. to Behave with Discretion
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Urges U.S. to Behave with Discretion
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is letting out an argument that it can wage a "bloody nose operation" against the DPRK, thus touching off controversy.
					 It was disclosed shortly ago that coteries of the National Security Council of the White House said at a behind-the-door meeting of American experts on the Korean peninsula issue that Trump is seriously examining the "bloody nose operation" and that limited attack on the DPRK can be helpful to Trump's off-year election.
					
					 This has caused uproar of the public. Media are linking the "operation" to the facts that the appointment of the nominee as the U.S. ambassador to south Korea was withdrawn for his rejection of the hard-line military option and the U.S. nuclear strategic assets and special units are being amassed in and around the Korean peninsula, commenting that there can be a military conflict on the Korean peninsula in late March and early April after the end of the Winter Olympics.
					
					 Strong voices of concerns and denunciation of the Trump administration's military attack on the DPRK are being heard in different parts of the world, to say nothing of the U.S.
					
					 Much upset, the Trump group is reeling off pretexts that "the 'bloody nose operation' is a fiction produced by media" and "our policy goal is to put maximum pressure so as to induce north Korea into negotiating table".
					
					 The U.S. has gone reckless to attempt a military attack but this is last-ditch efforts of those driven into a tight corner due to their defeat in the DPRK-U.S. nuclear stand-off.
					
					 The U.S. can never provoke a war against the DPRK as long as the whole territory of the U.S. mainland is within the range of the DPRK's nuclear strike.
					
					 This is a stark reality whether the U.S. acknowledges or not.
					
					 It is ridiculous for the U.S. to try to browbeat the DPRK, still failing to understand the prestige and might of the DPRK which has towered as a world-level strategic state.
					
					 The U.S. has to clearly understand its rival and stop going reckless.
					
					 As the nuclear force of the DPRK targets the U.S. mainland, it would lead the U.S. to total destruction to again table the "bloody nose operation" which its predecessors discarded, being afraid of the horrible consequences.
					
					 Whether it is a limited attack or an all-out attack, provocation against the DPRK will not just make the U.S. bleed at the nose but face the end of the existence of the crime-woven state.
					
					 The U.S. Trump group should not run reckless.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts U.S. "2018 Nuclear Posture Review"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts U.S. "2018 Nuclear Posture Review"
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Recently the U.S. released "2018 nuclear posture review".
					 In the review the U.S. said that the DPRK together with China, Russia and Iran constitute "serious threats" to the U.S. and its allies, adding that it would start modernization of strategic nuclear weapons and the development of "low-intensity smaller nuclear weapons". Referring to the use of nuclear weapons, it said it would make counteraction when the U.S. and its allies are exposed to attack by non-nuclear weapons, to say nothing of nuclear weapons.
					
					 The review also said that they would never tolerate nuclear attack on the U.S. and countries friendly to it by north Korea, stressing that in no case can one exist after using nuclear weapons and that any attack by north Korea would lead to the "end of its regime".
					
					 This is a deception and mockery of humankind desirous of peace and security and an open declaration of a rogue state not to rule out a preemptive nuclear attack targeting the world including the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Now the new trend for the improvement of the north-south relations and detente has been created on the Korean Peninsula thanks to the proactive and compatriotic measure taken by the DPRK, arousing great support and interest from the public at home and abroad.
					
					 But the U.S. is leading the situation to a touch-and-go nuclear war phase by massively shipping into and around south Korea nuclear strategic hardware including nuclear carrier Carl Vinson and nuclear strategic bombers B-2, B-52.
					
					 Timed to coincide with this, the U.S. announced that it would expand the scope of the use of nuclear weapons so that they can be used at a time when it and its allies are exposed to attack by conventional weapons.
					
					 To threaten to use nuclear weapons as conventional weapons on the Korean Peninsula, the world's biggest hotspot area, is little short of declaring the start of a new thermo-nuclear war.
					
					 The former special aide for disarmament and nuclear non-proliferation of the U.S. National Security Council said that the greater number of nuclear weapons would increase the possibility of the outbreak of a nuclear war, branding the recent review as something foolish. An American nuclear expert, too, contended that this can easily cause an all-out nuclear war.
					
					 Figures of the U.S. political, military and academic circles expressed concerns about the danger of the Trump administration's nuclear policy, and Senator Dianne Feinstein from the Democratic Party rejected it, saying that there can never be a limited nuclear war.
					
					 The international community is denouncing the review, commenting that the U.S. can lead the whole world to Cold War again, the low-intensity nuclear weapons can become a train for a nuclear war as it has high possibility of being used for an actual war, and that Trump has chosen a reckless path.
					
					 The "nuclear posture review" is, in essence, little short of "preemptive nuclear attack order" and "nuclear war instruction" which clearly disclosed the U.S. sinister intention to realize its ambition for world domination based on unchallenged nuclear upper-hand.
					
					 The U.S. has to always bear in mind that its assertion that one can not exist after using nuclear weapons is apt for its own empire going reckless, being carried away by nuclear ambition.
					
					 The DPRK values peace but will never beg for it and will resolutely counter any act of harassing peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Those fond of fire are bound to perish in flames and the more attachment to the nukes of tyranny the U.S. has, the more dangerous the security and future of the "only superpower" will be.

articles.title: U.S. "Nuclear Posture Review" Blasted
articles.content:
U.S. "Nuclear Posture Review" Blasted
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Terming the DPRK's self-defensive nuclear deterrent a "threat" to the world peace, the U.S. recently made public a "2018 nuclear posture review" (NPR), in which it legalized the updating of nuclear weapons and the preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK.
					 In this regard, Rodong Sinmun in a commentary Tuesday says it is nothing but an open declaration of war by the rogue state, which means to dare make a preemptive nuclear strike on the DPRK in order to bring the Korean peninsula and the world into a nuclear holocaust.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The NPR invented by the Trump group is a product of the black-hearted intention to realize the ambition for aggression by starting a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula at any cost.
					
					 The Trump group, that shaped the DPRK policy billed "maximum pressure and engagement", is leaving no means untried to isolate and stifle the DPRK, while crying out for its "nuclear threat" and "denuclearization".
					
					 There prevails on the Korean Peninsula the atmosphere of detente and peace thanks to the DPRK's initiative and proactive compatriotic measure. But in the wake of the rapid deployment of nuclear strategic assets and special warfare forces to south Korea and its vicinity, the U.S. announced that it would resume the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises right after the Winter Olympics. It is also a deliberate provocation to turn the trend of the present situation back to confrontation and war.
					
					 The Trump group's racket for confrontation with the DPRK is a suicidal act of digging a pitfall of ruin by itself.
					
					 Once the DPRK starts its decisive military strike, the mainland of the U.S. as well as its military bases in the Pacific area of operations will never be safe.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservatives Slashed for Provocative Moves: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservatives Slashed for Provocative Moves: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The conservatives of south Korea, including the "Liberal Korea Party", incite anti-DPRK confrontation atmosphere, claiming that the DPRK art troupe's entry into Mukho port is "a serious issue weakening the sanctions" and "the entry should be prevented". And they staged such dirty farces as "press conference against Pyongyang Olympics", "demo against the visit of the art troupe "and "rally for the south Korean flag" almost every day.
					 Against this background, the conservative clan committed another never-to-be-condoned rowdyism at the Mukho Port where the ship "Mangyongbong-92" carrying the art troupe of the DPRK was set to arrive.
					
					 Commenting on the facts, Rodong Sinmun on Tuesday brands such moves as hysterics of human scum devoid of elementary etiquette, despicable confrontation maniacs that cannot exist even a moment without slandering the fellow countrymen.
					
					 The provocative moves of the conservative group spoiling the atmosphere for the improvement of inter-Korean relations are a last-ditch effort of those marginalized by the trend of the times, the news analyst says, and goes on:
					
					 Those displeased with the atmosphere of improved north-south relations and challenging the aspiration of the nation are only a handful. But if the outrages of such conservative gangsters trying to turn the Winter Olympics into a theater of confrontation, far from appreciating the sincere efforts of the fellow countrymen who share the joy for national event, are allowed, the trend toward improved north-south relations which has just started will be stemmed again and national reconciliation and unity can never be achieved.
					
					 The traitors to the nation who can never be reformed, the conservative group trying to dare to do harm to the DPRK's dignity, not content with viciously insulting the good intentions of the fellow countrymen, should be no longer allowed to exist within the nation.

articles.title: Judiciary Authorities of S. Korea Rejected for Defending Criminals
articles.content:
Judiciary Authorities of S. Korea Rejected for Defending Criminals
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations of south Korea have reportedly denounced the judicial authorities for defending criminals involved in the unprecedented Park Geun Hye-Choe Sun Sil power scandal.
					 The representative of the Minju Party on Feb. 7 condemned the court for having issued a ruling to set free Vice-President of Samsung Electronics Ri Jae Yong after sentencing him to punishment for mere form's sake.
					
					 The Peace and Justice Commission of the Council of Christian Churches contended it can not but ask the court bench for what reason only evidences proving crimes of Ri Jae Yong lose their effect.
					
					 Rejecting the court bench for crudely violating the spirit of the candle-light demonstrations to abolish the evil doings, the organization declared that the people can no longer trust the judiciary authorities.

articles.title: Complete Stop to DPRK-targeted War Exercises Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Complete Stop to DPRK-targeted War Exercises Urged in S. Korea 
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The Students Progress Solidarity of south Korea held a rally outside the U.S. embassy in Seoul on Feb. 10 and pressed for a complete stop to the war exercises against the north, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Jaju Sibo.
					 The speakers said the people are moved by the north's sincere efforts for the improvement of the south-north ties and peace.
					
					 They denounced the U.S. for chilling the atmosphere for peace, created with the Winter Olympics as an occasion, while kicking up the confrontational racket even in the land of south Korea, not content with resorting to the racket for sanctions and pressure on the DPRK.
					
					 The joint military exercises against the north should never be allowed in the future, they stressed.

articles.title: U.S., Japanese Authorities' War Threat Ruckus Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S., Japanese Authorities' War Threat Ruckus Slammed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- A Taejon promotion committee composed of civic and social bodies in Taejon area of south Korea held a press conference outside the Taejon city office on Feb. 9 to denounce the war threat ruckus by the U.S. and the Japanese authorities, according to the south Korean Internet newspaper Tongil News.
					 Speakers condemned U.S. Vice-President Pence and Japanese Prime Minister Abe for spraying ashes at other's event and undisguisedly hampering the improvement and development of inter-Korean relations while letting out a flurry of wild remarks and outbursts scuttling the Winter Olympics welcomed by all Koreans and the world peace-loving people.
					
					 In a press release the organization urged the U.S. and Japan not to cast a chill over the north and the south of Korea trying to join hands as they are responsible for the issue of the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: Over 160 Kimjongilia Festivals, Exhibitions Worldwide
articles.content:
Over 160 Kimjongilia Festivals, Exhibitions Worldwide
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The last three decades have witnessed more than 160 Kimjongilia festivals and exhibitions in the DPRK and abroad. Kimjongilia won special, gold and other top prizes at the 16 world horticultural expos and flower exhibitions.
					 The flower, named Kimjongilia, came into being as the flower of the sun on the occasion of the February holiday of Juche 77 (1988) by a prominent Japanese botanist who was fascinated by the personality of leader Kim Jong Il as a peerlessly great man.
					
					 The Korean army and people have devoted their wisdom and energies to the cultivation and dissemination of the immortal flower with loyalty to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 April 1988 witnessed a change in the study, cultivation and dissemination of the flower of the sun with the emergence of a modern Kimjongilia greenhouse at the Central Botanical Garden of the DPRK.
					
					 The Korea Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee was inaugurated in June 1995 and similar committees were formed in all provinces, which gave further momentum to cultivating and disseminating the flower throughout the country.
					
					 The Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition was built on the bank of Taedong River of Pyongyang in April 2002 and Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia greenhouses appeared across the country.
					
					 The flower in praise of the great man was also cultivated abroad.
					
					 After the formation of the Nordic Kimjongilia Association in Sweden in 1995, many organizations for disseminating and supporting the flower have been inaugurated one after another in countries and regions such as the Japanese Association of Kimjongilia Lovers and the Guinean Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Association.
					
					 Kimjongilia was officially registered as new species of begonia by the International Society for Horticultural Science in August 2004.
					
					 There took place 31 immortal flower festivals and exhibitions on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star and other national holidays in the DPRK after Kimjongilia exhibition was held to mark the 55th birthday of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The flower has come into fuller bloom even after his demise.
					
					 Over 173 500 potted Kimjongilias have been displayed at the six Kimjongilia festivals since the year 2012 and their visitors numbered more than 2 266 500.
					
					 In 2013 alone, 26 Kimjongilia shows were held in Mongolia and Russia.
					
					 In 2014 over 15 000 potted Kimjongilias were on show at the exhibitions held in different countries to mark the 50th anniversary of the start of Kim Jong Il's work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The flower was awarded the best display prizes, special prizes, gold prizes and other top prizes at 16 world horticultural expositions and shows such as 2006 World Floricultural Show in Shenyang of China and 2011 International Horticultural Exposition in Xi'an of China.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries ahead of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, the Day of the Shining Star.
					 Seminars, book and photo exhibitions, film shows and Taekwon-Do demonstration performances were held in India, the Czech Republic and Sweden between Jan. 20 and 28.
					
					 Displayed at their venues were photos showing the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 There were also works of the great persons and books and photos dealing with the successes made by the Korean army and people.
					
					 "The Sun of Songun Shedding Its Rays All over the World", "Kimjongilia" and other Korean films were shown.
					
					 The chairman of the Indian Society for the Study of Works of Kim Jong Il said that the exploits Kim Jong Il performed for accomplishing the socialist cause will be kept in the hearts of the progressive people forever.
					
					 The chairperson of the Indian Study Group of Songun Politics said that Kim Jong Il developed the Workers' Party of Korea into the ever-victorious guiding force, the DPRK into the invincible socialist power, and the Korean People's Army into the matchless revolutionary ranks.
					
					 The first deputy chairman of the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association said that the Day of the Shining Star is a common holiday of the world progressive people as well as the Korean people.
					
					 The chief of the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea said that all the successes being achieved in the DPRK today would be unthinkable without the exploits of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Day of Sun and Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Venezuela
articles.content:
Day of Sun and Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Venezuela
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- A Venezuelan national preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) and the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed on Feb. 3.
					 Omar Lopez, chairman of the Venezuelan National Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected honorary chairman of the preparatory committee and Felix Jesus Velasquez Castillo, general coordinator of the Federal Political Secretariat of the United Left Party of Venezuela, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold diverse political and cultural events in praise of the exploits performed by the peerlessly great men in accomplishing the socialist cause and the global cause of independence on the occasion of the 106th birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung and the 76th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Russia
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Russia on Feb. 4.
					 The preparatory committee comprises of Juche idea study organizations in Russia.
					
					 Dmitri Kostenko, chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events including a meeting and a seminar in praise of the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Ireland
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Ireland
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- An Irish preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed on Feb. 3.
					 Irina Malenko, chairwoman of the Ireland-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairwoman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events such as a seminar and a film show in praise of the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un se reune con miembros de la delegacion de alto nivel de RPDC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un se reune con miembros de la delegacion de alto nivel de RPDC
Pyongyang, 13 de febrero (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, se reunio el dia 12 con los miembros de la delegacion de alto nivel de la RPDC que regresaron de la parte Sur tras visitarla para participar en la ceremonia inaugural de los XXIII Juegos Olimpicos Invernales.
					Participaron en la ocasion Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, Kim Yo Jong, primera subjefa de departamento del Comite Central del PTC, Choe Hwi, presidente del Comite Estatal de Direccion de Deportes, Ri Son Gwon, presidente del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria, y otros integrantes de la delegacion y los acompanantes.
					
					Tambien, estuvieron presentes Kim Yong Chol, vicepresidente del CC del PTC, y Jo Yong Won, subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC. 
					
					El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un tomo una tras otra las manos de los miembros y acompanantes de la delegacion y evaluo altamente sus trabajos abnegados. Seguidamente, escucho el informe detallado de ellos. 
					
					Kim Yong Nam informo detalladamente al Maximo Dirigente las actividades de la delegacion como la participacion en la ceremonia inaugural de ese evento deportivo y la visita a Chongwadae. 
					
					Kim Yo Jong, quien realizo actividades segun las ordenes especiales del Maximo Dirigente, le dijo concretamente los estados de encuentro con el presidente Moon Jae In y otras figuras superiores de la parte surcoreana, la intencion de la parte Sur y la tendencia de la parte norteamericana captadas en el presente periodo, etc. 
					
					El Maximo Dirigente expreso satisfaccion por el informe de regreso de la delegacion y expreso agradecimiento diciendo que fue impresionante el aspecto de la parte surena que dio importancia particular a la visita de los miembros de nuestra parte participantes en la olimpiada inclusive la delegacion de alto nivel e hizo ingentes esfuerzos por asegurar bien sus comodidades y actividades.
					
					Es importante seguir acumulando los resultados excelentes al sublimar mas el ambiente positivo de la reconciliacion y el dialogo logrado por la fuerte aspiracion y la voluntad conjunta del Norte y el Sur con motivo de la presente olimpiada, recalco. Y presento detalladamente el rumbo del desarrollo futuro para el mejoramiento de relaciones intercoreanas y dio al dominio correspondiente las instrucciones programaticas de tomar las medidas practicas para este fin. 
					
					Y se tomo la foto de recuerdo junto con los miembros de la delegacion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un se fotografia con miembros de Orquesta Samjiyon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un se fotografia con miembros de Orquesta Samjiyon
Pyongyang, 13 de febrero (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, se reunio con los miembros de la Orquesta Samjiyon que regresaron tras ofrecer con exito en la parte surena las funciones festivas para los XXIII Juegos Olimpicos Invernales y se fotografio junto a ellos. 
					El Maximo Dirigente felicito cordialmente los exitos de la orquesta que mediante sus actividades excelentes e impresionantes transmitio el ardiente alma de los habitantes de la parte Norte aspirantes a la exitosa realizacion de esa cita deportiva y la armonia nacional y dio alegria a los compatriotas de la parte Sur. 
					
					Tras informarse por parte de los integrantes de la orquesta sobre el ambiente del lugar de la funcion y sus repercusiones, mostro gran satisfaccion diciendo que se siente muy alegre si el matrimonio del presidente Moon Jae In y los compatriotas surenos se complacieron respondiendo y aclamando ardientemente.
					
					Dio agradecimiento a los miembros de la orquesta quienes prepararon en un corto tiempo la funcion con la elevada habilidad artistica y la sincera posicion de ejecucion y la realizo exitosamente en el nivel supremo. Seguidamente, se tomo una foto de recuerdo junto con ellos.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias al presidente ruso
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias al presidente ruso
Pyongyang, 13 de febrero (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 12 un mensaje de condolencias al presidente de la Federacion Rusa, Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, en relacion con que se produjeron muchas perdidas humanas por la caida de un avion de pasajeros en Rusia.
					En su misiva, el remitente extendio la profunda compasion y consuelo al destinatario y, por su conducto, a las victimas y sus familiares.
					
					Deseo sinceramente que se alivie cuanto antes la tristeza de los familiares de difuntos y llegue la estabilidad.

articles.title: Canciller coreano expresa condolencias a su homologo ruso
articles.content:
Canciller coreano expresa condolencias a su homologo ruso
Pyongyang, 13 de febrero (ACNC) -- El canciller coreano Ri Yong Ho envio el dia 12 a su homologo ruso Sergei Viktorovich Lavrov un mensaje de condolencias en relacion con que un accidente aereo causo numerosas perdidas humanas en Rusia.
					El remitente expreso al destinatario la profunda compasion y condolencias que hizo extensivas a las victimas y sus familiares.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae reconoce labores de varias unidades de provincia de Hwanghae del Sur
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae reconoce labores de varias unidades de provincia de Hwanghae del Sur
Pyongyang, 13 de febrero (ACNC) -- Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y del CC del PTC, averiguo en el terreno los trabajos de varias unidades de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur.
					En la Granja Cooperativa de Samjigang del distrito de Jaeryong donde estan impregnadas las hazanas directivas de los Lideres coreanos, Choe estimulo a los granjeros que logran innovaciones en la preparacion del cultivo agricola y les explico el requisito de la politica del partido y los problemas metodologicos que se presentan en la aceptacion de los metodos cientificos de agricultura.
					
					Al recorrer la Granja Cooperativa de Sinchang del distrito de Sinwon, la Fabrica de Maquinas Agricolas de Remolque de Haeju y la filial de ciencias agricolas de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, subrayo que las organizaciones y funcionarios partidistas deben cumplir satisfactoriamente con su mision de la fila vanguardista y el abanderado en la materializacion de la politica del partido.
					
					En las reuniones consultivas efectuadas en el terreno se tomaron las medidas para conquistar la meta de produccion agricola del presente ano basandose en los exitos y experiencias alcanzados en el pasado.

articles.title: Inaugurado XXII Festival de Kimjongilias
articles.content:
Inaugurado XXII Festival de Kimjongilias 
Pyongyang, 13 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, quedo iniciado en esta capital el XXII Festival de Kimjongilias con el tema de "Kimjongilias florecidas plenamente en la Corea del Juche glorificada como gran potencia".
					Estan colocadas en la sede del festival las imagenes del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					    En la edicion de este ano se exhiben decenas de miles de kimjongilias cultivadas por muchas unidades, incluso los organismos de fuerzas armadas, ministerios y organos centrales, los trabajadores de distintos estratos, los jovenes y ninos escolares del pais.
					
					    Tambien figuran las ejemplares expuestas por los coreanos residentes en ultramar y sus entidades, incluso la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon, las representaciones diplomaticas de varios paises y de organizaciones internacionales acreditadas en Corea, las entidades de amistad y solidaridad y las personalidades extranjeras.
					
					    La ceremonia de inauguracion tuvo lugar el dia 13 en la Exposicion Permanente de Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia.
					
					    Participaron aqui el vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Pak Kwang Ho, el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Yang Hyong Sop, el vicepremier, Jon Kwang Ho, los funcionarios del comite organizador del festival y unidades exponentes, los militares del Ejercito Popular y los trabajadores.
					
					    Tambien estuvieron presentes los compatriotas en ultramar y los huespedes extranjeros que visitan a Corea para participar en el festival.
